article: How to Farm Ascendant Shards: Fastest Methods in Destiny 2

steps.title: Win the Trials of Osiris games.
steps.subtitle: The Trials of Osiris is a higher-stakes variant of Crucible, with PvP (player-versus-player) matches that yield some of the game’s best weapons and armor. If you win 7 matches in a row (with no losses whatsoever), you’ll get an Ascendant Shard from the Lighthouse Chest.
sub-points: None of the recommended steps in this guide will net a ton of shards right away—but by continually doing these things over time, you’ll gain all the shards you need!

steps.title: Ascendant shards are a type of material in .
steps.subtitle: In the first  game, Ascendant Shards were used during Year 1 but eventually phased out. In , they returned as an exotic material typically used in high-quality crafting. Since season 22, players can have no more than 30 Ascendant Shards on their accounts—and can’t have any on their Postmaster.
sub-points: That means players can’t stockpile as many Ascendant Shards as they could in earlier seasons of the game.

steps.title: Ascendant shards are used to masterwork Legendary and Exotic armor.
steps.subtitle: Exotic armor pieces require 3 shards to successfully masterwork, while legendary armor pieces only need 1. Since Ascendant Shards are rare, it’s a good idea to think carefully about the best ways to spend them—and use them sparingly! You can also use them to:
sub-points: Purchase exotic weapons from the Tower’s Lost Lights kiosk.
Focus exotic gear with Rahool (in the Tower).
